name: The Euro is introduced as electronic currency
Haiti declares independence from France
British authorities seize the Stone of Scone from Scotland
Apple Computer is incorporated
Construction of the Golden Gate Bridge begins
Samuel Morse demonstrates the telegraph
Galileo Galilei discovers three of Jupiter's moons
The Battle of New Orleans takes place
Apple unveils the iPhone at Macworld
The League of Nations is established
The first session of the United States Supreme Court is held
The Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo is signed, ending the Mexican-American War
The Communist Manifesto is published
Facebook is founded by Mark Zuckerberg
The Curtis Act abolishes tribal jurisdiction in Indian Territory
Queen Elizabeth II begins her reign
The Beatles arrive in the United States for the first time
The first Academy Awards ceremony is held
The Endeavour space shuttle is launched
Alexander Graham Bell makes the first successful telephone call
The Blizzard of 1888 begins along the eastern seaboard
World Wide Web is made publicly available
The planet Uranus is discovered by William Herschel
Albert Einstein publishes his general theory of relativity
Julius Caesar is assassinated by Roman senators
Microsoft is founded by Bill Gates and Paul Allen
Martin Luther King Jr. is assassinated in Memphis
The Titanic sets sail from Southampton
Apollo 13 oxygen tank explodes
Abraham Lincoln is assassinated by John Wilkes Booth
The Titanic sinks after hitting an iceberg
The Boston Marathon bombing occurs
The first McDonald's restaurant opens
The first human spaceflight by Yuri Gagarin
The Empire State Building opens in New York City
The construction of the Hudson River Tunnel is begun
Germany surrenders to the Allied forces, ending World War II in Europe
The first transcontinental railroad is completed
The first kibbutz is founded in Palestine
Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay reach the summit of Mount Everest
Constantinople falls to the Ottoman Turks
Kentucky becomes the 15th U.S. state
The first American troops arrive in France during World War I
D-Day: Allied forces invade Normandy
The Six-Day War begins
Robert F. Kennedy is assassinated
Ronald Reagan gives his "Tear down this wall" speech in Berlin
Nelson Mandela is sentenced to life in prison
The Magna Carta is sealed by King John of England
The Battle of Gettysburg begins
The Declaration of Independence is adopted
The Rosetta Stone is discovered in Egypt
The French Revolution begins with the Storming of the Bastille
Apollo 11 lands on the Moon
The first atomic bomb is tested at Trinity Site
World War I begins
Columbus sets sail on his first voyage
The atomic bomb is dropped on Hiroshima
The atomic bomb is dropped on Nagasaki
Singapore becomes an independent nation
The Berlin Wall is erected
India gains independence from the United Kingdom
Elvis Presley dies
The Great Fire of London starts
World War II begins with Germany's invasion of Poland
The terrorist attacks on the World Trade Center and Pentagon occur
The Star-Spangled Banner is written by Francis Scott Key
The first Oktoberfest is held in Munich
The U.S. Constitution is signed
The Gregorian calendar is first adopted in Italy and Spain
Christopher Columbus reaches the New World
The Cuban Missile Crisis begins
The stock market crash of 1929 begins
The United Nations is founded
Sputnik 1, the first artificial satellite, is launched
The Suez Canal opens for the first time
The Berlin Wall falls
The Gettysburg Address is delivered by Abraham Lincoln
John F. Kennedy is assassinated in Dallas
Charles Darwin publishes On the Origin of Species
The first wagon train reaches California
The Wright brothers make their first powered flight
The first Nobel Prizes are awarded
The Titanic begins construction
The Boston Tea Party takes place
The Soviet Union is officially dissolved
Charles Dickens publishes A Christmas Carol
Apollo 8 launches, the first manned mission to orbit the Moon
The first human heart transplant is performed by Christiaan Barnard
